dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabits small creeks with dense vegetation (Ref. 43281).  It is common in roadside ditches and similar lentic habitats in lowland (Ref. 46238).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Range Description
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Dahanukar, N. 2012. Badis ruber. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: Widely distributed in southern Myanmar up to Mandalay (Ayeyarwaddy, Sittaung and Salween drainages, as well as smaller drainages), and also reported from the Mekong in Chiang Rai and Nong Khai provinces, northern Thailand, and from Luang Prabang Province, Lao PDR (Kottelat 2001).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  Mekong basin in Laos and Thailand, Salween and Irrawaddy basins.
dataObjects.references: Kottelat, M. 2001 Fishes of Laos. WHT Publications Ltd., Colombo 5, Sri Lanka. 198 p. (Ref. 43281)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal spines (total): 16 - 18; Dorsal soft rays (total): 8 - 10;  Analspines: 3; Analsoft rays: 6 - 8; Vertebrae: 26 - 29

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Kottelat, M. 2001 Fishes of Laos. WHT Publications Ltd., Colombo 5, Sri Lanka. 198 p. (Ref. 43281)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Possesses a dark blotch on the dorsolateral aspect of the caudal peduncle.  Postorbital stripe angled.  Caudal peduncle blotch large, extending dorsally across dorsal margin of caudal peduncle.  Black spots in vertical bars on sides; faint pattern of alternating light and dark stripes along the side.  Caudal fin base with 3 distinct dark blotches basally.  Scales in lateral row 26-28 (Ref. 46238).

dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2012

Assessor/s
Dahanukar, N.

Reviewer/s
Britz, R., Dey, S.C., Jha, B.R., Kottelat, M. & Allen, D.

Contributor/s
Molur, S.

Justification
Since the species is widespread in southern Myanmar and present in the Mekong in northern Thailand, and there are no known serious threats, the species is assessed as Least Concern.

History
  • 2010
    Least Concern
